txt.en:
'I have heard many tales of your mettle in battle, [placeholder]. Word of your deeds spreads across Eriador like flame upon the grasses at summer's height. Indeed, I fear there is little I can do to add to your skill.

'But you should not despair, for there are other wardens, great warriors of much renown, who might still be able to teach you what I cannot. One such is Hrotha. His tales exceed yours still, so he may avail you yet.

'If you wish to find Hrotha, and if his travels have not taken him far afield, you will find him in Ost Guruth in the Lone-lands.'

Warden: Watching the Marches

'Hrotha, a warden of great fame, dwells in Ost Guruth in the Lone-lands. Seek him out if you wish to continue your training.'
As a Warden, you have achieved such renown as to receive a summons from Hrotha at Ost Guruth.\n\nYou should seek Hrotha to receive further training in your class.

'So, [placeholder], you think there are things I can teach you? Yes, I have heard of you. All of us who range the wilds of Eriador, be we Elf or Dúnadan or Eglan, have heard the tales. And yet you have sought me out, so what am I to do with you?\n\n'I am no sage, hiding in some old broken skull of a keep, speaking riddles to all who cross my threshold, and you are not the first warrior to ask me my secrets.'

'So, [placeholder], you think there are things I can teach you? Yes, I have heard of you. All of us who range the wilds of Eriador, be we Elf or Dúnadan or Eglain, have heard the tales. And yet you have sought me out, so what am I to do with you? I am no sage, hiding in some old broken skull of a keep, speaking riddles to all who cross my threshold, and you are not the first warrior to ask me my secrets.

'And to that, I will tell you as I have told the others: I know no secrets, or none that could be called wisdom. I trust my spear and my arm, my corselet and the strength of my heart. And perhaps that is the greatest lesson of our kind, to trust in yourself, the weapon you wield, and the armour you wear.

'Very well, then. That is where we shall begin, if you want. I will see you properly armed, and we will call that a kind of wisdom.'
Meet Hrotha for further Warden training
Your spear-arm is strong and your heart is stout. With your like watching over the marches of Middle-earth, the forces of the Enemy shudder with dread.
